java.lang.String.value: The Yammer project will help to connect to Yammer ressources such as people connections or searches. This projects defines the Yammer connector to handle the Yammer API and the YammerHtml connector to handle the OAuth pincode verification process. In order to use this project, you must configure in the GetOAuthToken transaction the APIKey and the APISecret variables to the ones you obtained when you register your application with Yammer OAuth. (See https://www.yammer.com/api_doc.html)
This connector will handle all REST calls to Yammer including the initial GetToken for the OAuth protocol

This is the first transaction to be called. This must be called within the Login Sequence. The goal of this transaction is to initiate the OAuth protocol. It is mandatory to configure the APIKey and the APISecret variables to the values provided by Yammer when you register an new Application. You can register to a Yammer app on this page : https://www.yammer.com/api_oauth.html!
Note: your key and secret will only work for your Yammer network.
If you want your application's key and secret to work across ALL Yammer networks, you must request this to Yammer support.
The value of the apiKey you receive when you register a new application with Yammer
The value of the apiKey you receive when you register a new application with Yammer
The value of the apiSecret you receive when you register a new application with Yammer
The value of the apiSecret you receive when you register a new application with Yammer

The Search API returns information from a keyword, it can be a theme or an nameid. It lets you implement most of what shows up when you do a search in the top right box on Yammer.com.
Use the Search API to find message or people using keywords, company, name, or other criteria. It returns a list of matching member users or messages. Each entry can contain much of the information available on the users profile page or on the details of the messages.
Only 20 results of each type will be returned for each page, but a total count is returned with each query. page=1 (the default) will return items 1-20, page=2 will return items 21-30, etc.
The keyword field
This allows you to limit the number of results of each type per page, up to a maximum of 20, the default value.
Only 20 results of each type will be returned for each page, but a total count is returned with each query. page=1 (the default) will return items 1-20, page=2 will return items 21-30, etc.
The keyword field
This allows you to limit the number of results of each type per page, up to a maximum of 20, the default value.
The keyword field
Only 20 results of each type will be returned for each page, but a total count is returned with each query. page=1 (the default) will return items 1-20, page=2 will return items 21-30, etc.
This allows you to limit the number of results of each type per page, up to a maximum of 20, the default value.
This transaction verifies the OAuth pincode. It is called by the login sequence and must not be called directly.
new variable
This connector will Handle the Pincode verification process needed for the the "oob" (aka "out-of-band") functionality provided by OAuth, which redirects to Yammer page that displays a PIN.

This transaction will use the User and Password variables provided to Authenticate to Yammer. As we use the OAuth protocol, Yammer will respond with a PinCode this transaction retreives to be verified by the OAuth protocol.

transaction.handlers: // handlers are handled by Statements for HTML Transaction.

java.lang.String.value: "https://www.yammer.com/oauth/authorize?oauth_token=" + token
